page.title: 13ART GALLERY CHALFONTSTGILES.
page.content: At the top of the hill,in the part of the village known as Three Households, which once it was,stands a low,timbered listed building,once the shop of the hamlet -Three Households Gallery.This gallery which opened in 1971 supports local artists and crafts men from Bucks and a few from Berks and Bedfordshire. There are two directors,Mrs.Tessa Lomas and Mr.Newton and they invite people to exhibit at no charge.There are paint ings,pottery,a little jewellery and all is for sale.Some of the artists who have exhibited here have become well known nationally.An average of 70 people a week visit the gallery.An original water colour costs between 90 and 100 pounds,an original oil between 110 and 120 pounds and a pen and wash about 25 pounds.
